body_html:
Unfortunately, I am not aware of such a lint. However, I could think of an idea where the _add_docstr() method could be a bit more structured. We could separate the documentation into 4 classes:

  1. Description
  2. Formula / Expression
  3. Shape
  4. Example.

Exposing this could localize errors quicker. Excluding grammatical errors, most of the errors occur either in Expression or Example. Expressions can be checked using a LaTeX compiler.

body:
Unfortunately, I am not aware of such a lint. However, I could think of an idea where the `_add_docstr()` method could be a bit more structured. We could separate the documentation into 4 classes:
1. Description
2. Formula / Expression
3. Shape
4. Example.

Exposing this could localize errors quicker. Excluding grammatical errors, most of the errors occur either in Expression or Example. Expressions can be checked using a LaTeX compiler.
